sys_remote_update_set.description: Adds a Script Include & Fix Script that has a function to lookup on which table an sys_id belongs to.
sys_remote_update_set.name: Find Sys_id

sys_update_xml.name: sys_script_include_ff56664a0fc493004cf365ba32050e87
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_script_include"><sys_script_include action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><access>public</access><active>true</active><api_name>global.findSysID</api_name><client_callable>false</client_callable><description>Functionality to find which table a specific sys_id belongs to.</description><name>findSysID</name><script><![CDATA[/**
 * Searches the sys_id and returns string about the result.
 *
 * @param {string} sys_id - sys_id of the record that is to be found.
 * @return {string} information about the result and an URL if an record is found
 */
function findSysID(sys_id){

    var table_name = [];
	var returnStr = 'Searching for sys_id: ' + sys_id +  ' and the result is:\n\n';
    var table = new GlideRecord('sys_db_object');  
    table.orderBy('name');  
    table.query();  
    while (table.next()) {  
        if ((table.getValue('name') != '') &&  
            (table.getValue('name').substring(0,2) != 'ts') &&  
            (table.getValue('name').substring(0,2) != 'v_') &&  
            (table.getValue('name').substring(0,3) != 'dis') &&
			(table.getValue('name').substring(0,2) != 'pa') &&
            (table.getValue('name').substring(0,3) != 'dsc') &&  
            (table.getValue('name').substring(0,3) != 'ecc') &&  
            (table.getValue('name').substring(0,3) != 'ha_') &&  
            (table.getValue('name').substring(0,3) != 'wf_') &&  
            (table.getValue('name').substring(0,3) != 'win') &&
			(table.getValue('name').substring(0,8) != 'sys_roll') &&
            (table.getValue('name').substring(0,4) != 'sysx'))  {  
				
			var object = new GlideRecord(table.name);  
			if (object.get(sys_id)) {  
				table_name.push(table.name.toString());  
			}  
		}  
    }          
    if (table_name) {  
        return returnStr += 'Found ' + sys_id + ' in table(s): ' + table_name.join(', ') + '.\n Use nav_to.do?uri=' + table_name[0] + '.do?sys_id=' + sys_id;  
    }  
    else {  
        return returnStr += 'Did not find sys_id ' + sys_id + '.';  
    }
}]]></script><sys_class_name>sys_script_include</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2018-02-04 15:40:53</sys_created_on><sys_id>ff56664a0fc493004cf365ba32050e87</sys_id><sys_mod_count>12</sys_mod_count><sys_name>findSysID</sys_name><sys_package display_value="Global" source="global">global</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="Global">global</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sys_script_include_ff56664a0fc493004cf365ba32050e87</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2018-02-04 20:51:55</sys_updated_on></sys_script_include></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sys_script_fix_89daa60e0fc493004cf365ba32050e2a
sys_update_xml.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="sys_script_fix"><sys_script_fix action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><active>true</active><before>false</before><description>This script is used to locate which table a specific sys_id belongs to. Depending on the size of the tables and records. It might be recommended to process this through a worker (Background) to avoid timeout.</description><flush_cache>false</flush_cache><name>Find SysID</name><run_once>true</run_once><script><![CDATA[var sys_id = 'YOUR_SYS_ID_HERE';//Put in the sys_id you're looking for here gs.info(findSysID(sys_id));]]></script><sys_class_name>sys_script_fix</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2018-02-04 16:00:58</sys_created_on><sys_id>89daa60e0fc493004cf365ba32050e2a</sys_id><sys_mod_count>14</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Find SysID</sys_name><sys_package display_value="Global" source="global">global</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="Global">global</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sys_script_fix_89daa60e0fc493004cf365ba32050e2a</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2018-02-04 20:59:00</sys_updated_on><unloadable>false</unloadable></sys_script_fix></record_update>
